greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Start with 1, add the next number if one gets a prime then add the next number else subtract the next...
comment: Note that a(22) = -163 is the last prime generated by this sequence. All subsequent terms are composite and equal (16-n)(n+17)/2.
example: a(1) = 1, a(2) = 1+2 =3 is a prime hence a(3) = 3 +3 = 6 which is composite hence a(4) = 6-4 = 2 etc.
results.author: _Amarnath Murthy_, Aug 30 2002
ext: Corrected and extended by _Jason Earls_, Sep 01 2002
